intro: Coreopsis ochracea, commonly known as the yellow coreopsis, is a flowering plant native to the eastern and central United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet and features narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are bright yellow with a distinctive orange center, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Coreopsis ochracea is known for its hardiness and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
